definitions: materials used for writing such as paper, envelopes, and pens
examples: The office supply store sells all kinds of stationery
She bought elegant stationery for her wedding invitations

definitions: person in charge of operations at a railway or train station
examples: The stationmaster announced the delayed arrival of the express train
We spoke to the stationmaster about lost luggage procedures

definitions: single piece of numerical information collected for analysis or reference
examples: That statistic about unemployment surprised everyone at the meeting
Each statistic in the report needs proper verification

definitions: professional who collects, analyzes, and interprets numerical data using mathematical methods
examples: The company hired a statistician to analyze market trends
Our team's statistician predicted the election results accurately

definitions: statues collectively or the art of making statues from stone or metal
examples: The museum's ancient Greek statuary attracts thousands of visitors
Renaissance statuary often depicted religious and mythological themes

definitions: miniature statue used as decoration or award
examples: She placed the porcelain statuette carefully on the mantel
The film festival presents golden statuettes to winning directors

definitions: natural height of a person when standing upright
level of respect or importance in society or profession
examples: The basketball player's impressive stature made him stand out
Her small stature didn't prevent her athletic success
The scientist gained international stature after winning the prize
His stature in the community grew through charitable work

definitions: curved wooden strip forming part of a barrel or cask
set of five horizontal lines on which musical notes are written
examples: The cooper replaced a broken stave in the wine barrel
Each stave must fit perfectly to prevent leaks
Students learned to read notes on the musical stave
The composer wrote complex melodies across multiple staves

definitions: position or role that someone or something should have or fill
examples: His assistant attended the meeting in his stead
The new technology will serve us well in good stead

definitions: restaurant specializing in serving steaks and other beef dishes
examples: They celebrated their anniversary at an upscale steakhouse downtown
The steakhouse is famous for its dry-aged beef selection

definitions: someone who takes another person's property without permission
examples: Security cameras helped identify the bicycle stealer quickly
The spotlight stealer always interrupts others during presentations

definitions: action of taking someone else's property without permission or legal right
examples: The store owner reported multiple incidents of stealing
Stealing from the company led to immediate termination

definitions: cautious and secretive action or movement to avoid detection
examples: The cat moved with stealth toward the unsuspecting bird
Military operations often require stealth to succeed

definitions: boat powered by a steam engine, especially used on rivers
examples: Mark Twain wrote about life on Mississippi River steamboats
The old steamboat still offers scenic tours every summer

definitions: large ship powered by steam engines for ocean travel
kitchen utensil that cooks food using steam from boiling water
examples: Immigrants arrived in America aboard crowded steamers
The luxury steamer crossed the Atlantic in five days
She prepared healthy vegetables using her bamboo steamer
The dim sum restaurant serves dumplings in traditional steamers

definitions: science fiction genre featuring steam-powered technology in Victorian-era settings
examples: Her steampunk costume included goggles and brass gears
The steampunk novel imagined airships powered by steam engines

definitions: large ship propelled by steam engines for passenger or cargo transport
examples: The historic steamship has been converted into a museum
Transatlantic steamship travel revolutionized international commerce

definitions: horse, especially a spirited one used for riding
examples: The knight mounted his trusty steed before battle
Her white steed galloped gracefully across the field

definitions: person who works in steel production or manufacturing
examples: His grandfather worked as a steelman for forty years
The steelman wore protective gear against the intense heat

definitions: container or device used for steeping or soaking something in liquid
examples: Place the tea leaves in the steeper for five minutes
The coffee steeper produces a smooth, rich brew

definitions: tall pointed structure on top of a church building, often containing bells
examples: The church steeple could be seen from miles away
Lightning struck the steeple during yesterday's thunderstorm

definitions: horse race over a course with obstacles including fences and water jumps
examples: The steeplechase requires both speed and jumping ability
She trained her horse specifically for steeplechase competitions

definitions: castrated male bovine animal raised for beef production
examples: The rancher separated the steers from the breeding bulls
These steers will be ready for market next spring

definitions: lowest class passenger accommodation on a ship, historically in the stern
examples: Many immigrants traveled to America in crowded steerage compartments
Steerage passengers endured harsh conditions during ocean crossings

definitions: mechanism or action of controlling the direction of a vehicle or vessel
examples: The car's power steering makes parking much easier
Proper steering technique is essential for safe driving

definitions: large mug for beer, traditionally made of ceramic with a hinged lid
examples: He collected decorative German steins from various breweries
The Oktoberfest stein held a full liter of beer

definitions: strong and very unpleasant smell that causes discomfort
examples: The stench from the garbage truck filled the street
We couldn't ignore the stench coming from the basement

definitions: thin sheet with cut-out design used to apply patterns with paint or ink
examples: She used a stencil to paint flowers on the wall
The artist created intricate designs using handmade stencils

definitions: person skilled in taking dictation in shorthand and transcribing it
examples: The court stenographer recorded every word of the testimony
Before computers, every executive needed a skilled stenographer

definitions: small mesh tube inserted into blood vessels or ducts to keep them open
examples: The doctor placed a stent to open the blocked artery
His heart stent has greatly improved blood flow

definitions: son of one's stepparent from a previous relationship
examples: His stepbrother joined the family after his mother remarried
The stepbrothers became close friends despite the age difference

definitions: daughter of one's spouse from a previous relationship
examples: She treats her stepdaughter with the same love as her biological children
His stepdaughter asked him to walk her down the aisle

definitions: man who is married to one's mother but is not one's biological father
examples: Her stepfather taught her how to ride a bicycle
The stepfather adopted his wife's children after their wedding

definitions: woman who is married to one's father but is not one's biological mother
examples: The stepmother worked hard to build trust with her new family
Fairy tales often unfairly portray stepmothers as villains

definitions: large area of flat unforested grassland in southeastern Europe or Siberia
examples: Nomadic tribes have roamed the Mongolian steppe for centuries
The vast steppe stretched endlessly under the clear sky

definitions: fitness equipment that simulates climbing stairs for cardiovascular exercise
examples: She uses the stepper at the gym for thirty minutes daily
The mini stepper fits perfectly in her small apartment

definitions: daughter of one's stepparent from a previous relationship
examples: Her stepsister became her best friend over the years
The stepsisters shared a room after their parents married

definitions: son of one's spouse from a previous relationship
examples: He coached his stepson's soccer team every weekend
The stepson gradually accepted his mother's new husband

definitions: electronic equipment for playing recorded music with sound from two speakers
examples: They bought a new stereo system for their living room
The car stereo played her favorite songs during the trip

definitions: widely held but fixed and oversimplified image or idea of a particular type of person or thing
examples: We must challenge harmful stereotypes about different cultures
The movie unfortunately reinforced outdated gender stereotypes

definitions: process of making something free from bacteria or other living microorganisms
examples: Hospital equipment undergoes thorough sterilisation between patients
The sterilisation of surgical instruments prevents infection

definitions: condition of being unable to produce offspring or seeds
state of being free from bacteria or other living microorganisms
examples: The couple sought treatment for infertility after discovering his sterility
Some medications can cause temporary sterility in patients
The laboratory maintains strict sterility in all procedures
Sterility of the operating room is crucial for patient safety

definitions: process of making something completely clean and free from bacteria
medical procedure to permanently prevent reproduction
examples: The dental office follows strict sterilization protocols for all tools
Proper sterilization of baby bottles prevents harmful bacteria
She chose sterilization as a permanent birth control method
Pet sterilization helps control the animal population

definitions: British money system based on the pound
high-quality silver containing 92.5 percent pure silver
examples: The price was listed in pounds sterling
Sterling continues to fluctuate against the dollar
Her grandmother's sterling silver tea set was a family heirloom
The jeweler verified the sterling mark on the bracelet

definitions: back part of a ship or boat
examples: The captain stood at the stern watching the sunset
Waves crashed over the stern during the storm
